void LogStream::message ( int  level,
const std::string &  log,
bool  delimiter = true 
) [inline, virtual]

A message to be processed by the stream.

Parameters:
level - What level of verbosity is associated with this message, higher number == more verbosity.
log - Message that is to be processed.
delimiter - Should a delimiter be emitted as well?

Implements MsgHandler.

void LogStream::setBaseVerbosity ( int  level  )  [inline]

What level of verbosity is requested. As we're a log, we are going to ignore this and print out lots of stuff.

Parameters:
level - Level below which progress messages are printed.

Reimplemented from MsgHandler.

Definition at line 78 of file LogStream.h.

void LogStream::progressBegin ( int  verbosity,
const std::string &  msg,
int  total 
) [inline, virtual]

Begin a progress reporting. After this initial call the progressStep call will be called N times where N = the parameter total passed in below.

Parameters:
verbosity - What level of verbosity is the progress associated with. Higher levels of verbosity produce more messages.
msg - String message associated with the beginning of this task.
total - Expected number of times that the progressStep() will be called after this.

Implements ProgressHandler.

Definition at line 93 of file LogStream.h.

References Util::getTimeStamp(), m_Out, m_Total, and m_Verbosity.

void LogStream::progressStep ( int  verbosity  )  [inline, virtual]

This function is called when one unit of work has been done. In general it is expected that the units of work should be roughly equal in size.

Parameters:
verbosity - At what verbosity level should this step be displayed.

Implements ProgressHandler.

) [inline, virtual]

Signals the end of progress report.

Parameters:

msg - Closing message from calling function.
